Package teapot.rocket.components.assembly

Class Stage

java.lang.Object
teapot.rocket.components.Component
teapot.rocket.components.assembly.AssemblyComponent
teapot.rocket.components.assembly.Stage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Physical
public final class Stage extends AssemblyComponent
Represents a stage assembly component used in rocket construction.

This class extends AssemblyComponent and represents a stage of a rocket, consisting of BodyComponent instances.

To safely extend this class, subclasses should ensure that overridden methods maintain the expected behavior and adhere to the contract defined in this class.

For example, when subclassing Stage, ensure that overridden methods such as getWidth(), getHeight(), and getWeight() correctly handle the calculation.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Stage

      public Stage(ComponentBase componentBase, LinkedList<BodyComponent> body) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs a stage with the specified base information and body components.
      Parameters:
      componentBase - The base information of the stage.
      body - The list of BodyComponent instances within the stage. Represents body components that compose the stage.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If component configuration is invalid.

  • Method Details

    • getBody

      public LinkedList<BodyComponent> getBody()
      Retrieves body components of the stage.
      Returns:
      The list of BodyComponent instances within the stage. Represents body components that compose the stage.

    • calculateMovement

      public Vector calculateMovement()
      Calculates the movement vector of the stage based on its body components.
      Returns:
      The movement vector which stage provides.

    • getWidth

      public double getWidth()
      Gets the width of the component.

      This method can be implemented by subclasses to calculate the width of specific component types, for example, considering also the width of the component children.

      This method calculates the maximum width among body components in the stage.

      Specified by:
      getWidth in interface Physical
      Overrides:
      getWidth in class Component
      Returns:
      The maximum width of the stage based on its body components.

    • getHeight

      public double getHeight()
      Gets the height of the component.

      This method can be implemented by subclasses to calculate the height of specific component types, for example, considering also the height of the component children.

      This method calculates the total height of the stage by summing the heights of all body components.

      Specified by:
      getHeight in interface Physical
      Overrides:
      getHeight in class Component
      Returns:
      The total height of the stage based on its body components.

    • getWeight

      public double getWeight()
      Gets the weight of the component.

      This method can be implemented by subclasses to calculate the weight of specific component types, for example, considering also the weight of the component children.

      This method calculates the total weight of the stage by summing the weights of all body components and adding the base weight of the stage.

      Specified by:
      getWeight in interface Physical
      Overrides:
      getWeight in class Component
      Returns:
      The total weight of the stage based on its body components.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the stage.

      The string includes the name of the stage followed by the string representations of its body components, separated by new lines.

      Overrides:
      toString in class AssemblyComponent
      Returns:
      A string representation of the stage.
